descriptionSet.description: The image shows the rear of a postcard with a signet on the right hand corner spelling 'RTS'. It has a seal on the left hand corner and a smaller sized image of the signet in the left lower corner.

inscription.text: Tuck's Post Card Carte Postale Postkarte
[torn part] Native Life-India. Series I. Raphael Tuck & Sons [torn part] Lette" [Regd.] Postcard 7408. Art publishers to their Majesties the King & Queen.

Fakirs. The fakirs are a large body of religious fanatics. They go naked or in filthy rags, and partake only of the meanest food, and that without request or thanks. Their ethical code consists in the observance of truth, chastity, internal purity, constant repentance, and contemplation of Deity. In the East Indies they number over 3,000,000.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

text-en: Fakirs. The fakirs are a large body of religious fanatics. They go naked or in filthy rags, and partake only of the meanest food, and that without request or thanks. Their ethical code consists in the observance of truth, chastity, internal purity, constant repentance, and contemplation of Deity. In the East Indies they number over 3,000,000.
